title: Top 10 trending phones of week 11
description: It's starting to look a lot like a lengthy streak, the Samsung Galaxy A56 topping our trending chart for the second week in a row and with a comfortable margin too. The upcoming Poco X7 Ultra emerged an unlikely silver medalist, which suggests it might be able to mount a proper challenge once it goes official. [#InlinePriceWidget, 13603, 1#] Third goes to the Xiaomi 15 Ultra, the new flagship by the Chinese maker keeps making waves after its debut at the MWC last week. Newly announced Redmi Note 14S grabbed fourth ahead of the second Samsung phone of the chart, the Galaxy S25...
excerpt: Samsung clearly has another mid-range winner on its hands. It's starting to look a lot like a lengthy streak, the Samsung Galaxy A56 topping our trending...
text: It's starting to look a lot like a lengthy streak, the Samsung Galaxy A56 topping our trending chart for the second week in a row and with a comfortable margin too. The upcoming Poco X7 Ultra emerged an unlikely silver medalist, which suggests it might be able to mount a proper challenge once it goes official. Samsung Galaxy A56 These are the best offers from our affiliate partners. We may get a commission from qualifying sales. 128GB 8GB RAM₹ 41,999256GB 8GB RAM₹ 41,999Show all prices Third goes to the Xiaomi 15 Ultra, the new flagship by the Chinese maker keeps making waves after its debut at the MWC last week. Newly announced Redmi Note 14S grabbed fourth ahead of the second Samsung phone of the chart, the Galaxy S25 Ultra. Two more phones by the Korean maker follow with the Galaxy A36 in fifth and the Galaxy A55 in sixth. Behind them is the Nothing Phone (3a) Pro. Xiaomi Poco X7 Pro grabbed ninth, while the vanilla Xiaomi 15 completes this week's edition of the top 10. This means it's the first chart in many months without an Apple phone, the iPhone 16e seemingly unable to stay in the spotlight for now.
html:
It's starting to look a lot like a lengthy streak, the Samsung Galaxy A56 topping our trending chart for the second week in a row and with a comfortable margin too. The upcoming Poco X7 Ultra emerged an unlikely silver medalist, which suggests it might be able to mount a proper challenge once it goes official.

Samsung Galaxy A56

These are the best offers from our affiliate partners. We may get a commission from qualifying sales.
128GB 8GB RAM₹ 41,999
256GB 8GB RAM₹ 41,999
Show all prices

Third goes to the Xiaomi 15 Ultra, the new flagship by the Chinese maker keeps making waves after its debut at the MWC last week.

Newly announced Redmi Note 14S grabbed fourth ahead of the second Samsung phone of the chart, the Galaxy S25 Ultra.

Two more phones by the Korean maker follow with the Galaxy A36 in fifth and the Galaxy A55 in sixth. Behind them is the Nothing Phone (3a) Pro.

Xiaomi Poco X7 Pro grabbed ninth, while the vanilla Xiaomi 15 completes this week's edition of the top 10. This means it's the first chart in many months without an Apple phone, the iPhone 16e seemingly unable to stay in the spotlight for now.
